full_threads.body:
Hi Andy,

Can you please confirm if there are 50 product pages or 20 as per your price estimate?

Thanks

Bonnie Sudirwan

Marketing Communications Manager





bsudirwan@mayohardware.com.au



http://www.mayohardware.com.au/



0408 331 966



Customer Service: 1300 360 211


CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This e-mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information or otherwise be protected by law. Any unauthorised review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail and destroy all copies of the original message.

Hi Bonnie,

Quick update on the site rebuild.

We've reviewed the sitemap here - looks like the product pages use a different layout and we've got around 50 in total.

Since the original site was built using Avada and we're rebuilding in Breakdance, these will need to be manually recreated.

We're happy to take care of it, but just wanted to flag that it will come through in additional product pages at $99 each.

20 additional product pages x $99 = $1,980

Let us know if you'd like us to proceed on that basis or would like us to deprecate some of the product pages.

Thanks,
Andy

Hi @allieB. Yes this XML file can be imported to the website.
It seems like posts has been imported already on the website yesterday. Can you or @joel confirm that you imported the same XML file to the staging site? Thanks!
Hey @cindy can u let us know if the file is sufficient for importing the posts into staging 🙏.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Cindy Valderama

full_threads.body:
Hi Bonnie,

Thanks for following up and for sharing the XML file - appreciate you chasing this down.

We'll check this now and confirm shortly.

@Wolf IQ Support - can you please confirm if this file is sufficient for importing the posts into staging?

Thanks,
Andy

*****

Hi Bonnie,

Thanks for the updates. I've outlined everything below so we're aligned on scope and next steps.

Let us know if we've missed anything or if there's anything else to clarify.

Thanks,
Andy

***


Latest updates confirmed:

  1. We're using alfaforni.com/en as the structure - Yes, correct. what will the URL for the AU site be?
  2. Pages to be developed are listed under the Pages tab in the sitemap
  3. Archive + single templates will be created for:
  • Products (excluding Urbe, Futuro, Professional, and Limited Edition)
  • Recipes
  • Blog posts
  1. Additional archive-style pages to be developed:
  • https://www.alfaforni.com/en/product-category/bases-and-complements
  • https://www.alfaforni.com/en/product-category/residential-wood-and-gas-fired-ovens/stainless-steel/
  • https://www.alfaforni.com/en/tutorial/
  • https://www.alfaforni.com/en/all-recipes
  1. Pages under No Need to Develop are parameter-based archive URLs that won't be recreated - we'll use clean templates instead
Showroom Locator page:
  • Will be renamed from "Dealer Locator" - Please move forward with "Dealer Locator"
  • Sections will include:
    • Premium Dealer (with Alfa on display):
  1. Pizza Ovens R US
    • Dealers (online only):
  1. The Pizza Oven Store
  2. The BBQ Store
  3. Outdoor Living Australia
  4. Outback Pizza Ovens
  5. Outdoorhub
  6. Pizza Warehouse
  7. Adelaide Outdoor Kitchens
  8. The Authentic Italian
    • Harvey Norman stores with Alfa display:
  1. Gepps Cross
  2. Cairns
  3. Moore Park
  4. Balgowlah
Next steps:
  • All pages to be completed by Wednesday, July 23
  • Once approved, we'll aim to go live Thursday or Friday, July 24 or 25
  • For @Bonnie Sudirwan - please send through live site credentials so we can export content and prep staging I have requested from Italy… will provide ASAP.

Subject: Re: Alfa Forni website


Hi Bonnie,

Thanks for confirming - we'll use alfaforni.com/en as the structure.

To keep things aligned, our team has mapped out the full sitemap here.

What's in the sheet:

  • All pages to be developed
  • Archive/single templates for recipes, products, and blog posts
  • A "No Need to Develop" tab for archive pages that were crawled but won't be built

Most of these are straightforward builds, so we'll develop them directly in Breakdance - no need for a separate design phase.

On timeline:

  • We'll have all pages completed by next week Wednesday (July 23) for your review
  • Once approved, we can go live Thursday or Friday next week (July 24 or 25)

Lastly, could you send through the live site credentials? We'd like to export the existing posts and import them into staging for a smooth transition.

Let me know if anything in the sheet needs adjusting before we move forward.

Thanks again,
Andy
